Questions.Text:
It is important to review written work because missing or
incorrect citation could be considered a form of plagiarism.

Answer.FeedbackText:
Academic writing does require you to ensure that your
work is documented according to the appropriate style guide. Although these
citation appear in parenthesis or at the end of the document, and may therefore
seem like small or minor aspects of
your overall document, they are nevertheless an important and consequential
component.

Questions.Text:
Reviewing written work is important because the standards of
my future profession will make incomplete, inaccurate, or messy work
unacceptable.

Answer.FeedbackText:
Most industries value and expect written document to
portray a professional level of quality. All business writing aimed at
customers or clients, for example, should appear complete, correct, and clean,
and internal memos and documents are likely to be subject to the same standard.

Questions.Text:
It is important to review written work because the
evaluation rubric explicitly considers the overall clarity, accuracy, and
precision of both content and grammar / mechanics.

Answer.FeedbackText:
In an academic context, it’s reasonable to identify
“getting a good grade on the assignment” as one “purpose” of your writing. From
this perspective, it’s worthwhile to review your written work for clarity and
precision because you know that the instructor will be assessing these features.

Questions.Text:
It is important to review written work because it feels good
to submit a polished version of my work that feels like it represents the best
of what I’m able to do.

Answer.FeedbackText:
It can be easy to overlook the importance of our own
“pride of work” when our work is assessed and these assessments are documented
in official ways, like grades or performance reviews. However, students and
professionals alike know how good it can feel to stand behind their work and
know that they’ve done the best they can do.

Questions.Text:
It is important to review written work because imprecise or
incorrect technical details could cause significant harm, e.g., a machine could
begin to work improperly or unsafely, or a business could lose a client or
account.

Answer.FeedbackText:
Although your work might not require you to read or
write long-form documents, you might still be required to read and write
technical documents or care instructions that require a high-degree of
precision. For example, people working in the health care field will interact
with documents that could affect patient care, while people working in the
engineering field will encounter documents that ensure the safe operation of
powerful machines.

Questions.Text:
It is important to review written work because the content
of my writing might be included in a legal proceeding, such as a trial, and
could affect the outcome of the ruling.

Answer.FeedbackText:
Students in community service fields such as security,
police, and investigation might find that this applies to them, as their
written notes and observations can indeed be called upon in legal proceedings.
In addition, people working in social work and early childhood education may
find that they are required to produce or share documentation that will be used
in legal matters.
